title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 15 ยง 91.3 - Definitions
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 15 ยง 91.3 - Definitions

State Regulations
(a) Traffic
violation means a violation of any of the provisions of the Vehicle and Traffic

Law, any local law, ordinance or regulation, or order of the Department of

Transportation, relating to traffic, except parking violations. (b) Police officer includes any peace officer
or member of the State Police who is authorized to issue summonses for traffic
violations. (c) Enforcement agency
means each local police force, including county, town, city and village police
departments, sheriffs, and the Division of State Police. (d) Court includes any trial court, justice
or magistrate having jurisdiction over traffic violations. (e) Ticket means part I of the uniform
traffic ticket. (f) Packet means a
complete set of all parts of a uniform traffic ticket. (g) Uniform traffic ticket means the packet
consisting of a ticket, simplified traffic information, certificate of
conviction, enforcement agency copy and officer' s copy as specified in section
91.5
of this Part and in the forms
prescribed in section
91.7
of this Part. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 15
ยง
91.3

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
